text: #6 tasted in a stemmed tulip glass at Side Project Brewing tap room, thanks Cory! Mostly clear golden colour with white foam, lasting with lace. Familiar saison traits plus lightly toasted American oak foudre aging. Faint vanillin, campfire marshmallow. Crisp Pils grainbill, just enough peppery hops, hint of clove. Soda cracker mouthfeel, dry finish, but not thin or watery at all. High carbonation, digestive. Tart but not excessively sour nor funky. Delicious, no wonder its so highly rated, stands up to the hype.

Bottle (Shared by Tom- Thank you!); pours hazy yellow gold with a white head; aroma of tart citrus fruit, yeast funk, and hints of grass; taste is slightly tart with lemon and other citrus fruits, yeast funk, and traces of grass, wood, and wine; dry, slightly tart finish with some floral notes
A lotle haze, some white head. Surprisingly sour, some hops, yeast. A little sweetness. This is good and surprisingly sour for the style.
750ml bottle shared at tasting. Clear golden pour. Tart saison aroma, some citrus maybe. Taste is unbelievable, tart, refreshing. This is so well made!!
Bomber shared by Tom - thanks! Damn, this is good. Mostly clear light yellow pour with a small white head. Lemon, funk, yeast, tart. So good.
Aromat typowo saisonowy nieco funky. Lekkie, orzeźwiające, cytrusowe lekko kwaśne. Świetne!

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Red Session. Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is floral, citrusy, some wood, mild toffee and some champagne notes. Flavour is citrus, herbs, some yeast, dry wood, mild toffee and some earth.

Pours golden in color with a fizzy white head that fades quickly. Aroma is of mild Brett and lacto with a crisp and refreshing citric quality. Flavor is so well balanced that it jumps between sweet, tart and mildly bready. I nice touch of funk in the aftertaste. Just all around enjoyable to drink.

Bottle shared with Mark. Pours cloudy blonde with a fast dissipating head. Aroma is citrus, funky, some grains, some wood and chardonnay. Moderate acidity, light sweetness. Long lasting tart finish. Lovely!
Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2016. Clear yellow body with a small white head. Light yeast, white wine, oak.

Bottle pour at RB Best. It pours a hazy yellow color with a huge off white head. The aroma is soft and grainy with light vanilla funk. The flavor is full bodied with some lemon, apricots, light herbal funk and acidity. Really killer. Right in my wheelhouse.
Hazy yellow. Nice farmhouse and wine barrel character all together in a bright yet rustic package. Lightly fruity and funky. Good stuff.
Bottle at tads... Hazy pink.. Soft floral fruit funk nose... Soft funk fruit... Light dry floral fruit light acetic
Bottle at tads. Pours pale yellow orange, nose is funky, wood, grape, yeasty, taste is tart, zesty, bretty, sour, juicy.
Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with no head although there is a lot of head activity in the bottle. Taste is citrus sour, cream, vinous grape, oak, med-high gooseberry sour.

March 25, 2016. Bottle at Himmeriget. 
Hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is fruity, malty, funky and light herbal with lemon, vinous white grapes notes, hints of gooseberry skins, grain, hay, minerals, oak and some barnyard. Taste is tart, fruity, malty, vinous. Medium bodied, slight dry, average carbonation. Finish is slightly dry and tart with citrus, grape skins, oak, light malty sweetness with grain notes, some funky barnyard and hay notes.
Tap at CBC 16, red session. Aroma of citrus, lactobac. and brett. Wheat notes. Some wood. Mainly sour taste. A good one

Batch #4 bottle. Pours a golden yellow, some haziness, sudsy white head. Poured slow to get as little sediment as possible. Aromas of tart and sour funk, citrus, yeast, wine, berry, straw, grass, barnyard. Flavor had some lemon, barnyard funk, wine, berry, straw, bready yeast, super tart and sour. Medium body, sticky texture, lively carbonation, sour, tart, and funky finish. Amazing.

Rather opaque golden with a large white head. Aromas of wet wheat, barnyard funk, with some bright fruit esters. Effervescent, bright texture and light bodied. Briskly sweet with a clear sour-acidic note. Short-medium finish.
Off menu at FoFa at Hills Farmstead. A very pale gold pour with a super soft body. The aroma was like freshly threshed hay while the tadgr added a lemon-lime tartness.

Thank you Mathieu87 & PriorL! 750 ml. bottle sampled @ Epic beer Tasting 2016. Hazy citrus, little white head. Nose is rich lactic, zest, flowers, low lemon. Taste is mellow, lactic, dry, zest, complex, lovely mineral character, low funk, finish is puckering, big sour, lemon, Easy to drink. Quite sour but also quite delicious, great lemon & low mineral qualities. Very nice beer.

CBCNOR Bottleshare at Himmeriget, may 12th 2016. Hazy light orange body with a big white head. Beer wants to leave the bottle quick. No problem really as we wanted the beer just as much. Aroma is funky with white wine, pepper, berries and fruit Lovely lactic taste with farmhouse yeast spice, tropical fruits, berries, with a floral finish and a long lasting dry wine and acidic aftertaste. Excellent!

Draught @ CBC 2016. Pours yellow with white head. Aroma of light sourness, yeast, wood, hay, fruit, melon, grapes. Flavor is light sour, yeasty, wood, barn, fruit, hay, white wine grapes. Medium body, average carbonation, dry and light acidic finish. 140516
CBC. Slightly hazy golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, lemon, spices and yeast. Flavour is malt, fruit, lemon, yeast, little sour, medium dry, hop and a little bitter.

Aroma of chardonnay, apricot, stonefruit, yoghurt, oak, vanilla, lemon. Very vinous taste with clear oak, clear lacto, light brett funk with a big acidic lemon character. Super pillowy and perfect saison mouthfeel.

From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016 - Red session. Hazy yellow golden color with white head. Yeasty, malty and hoppy aroma, funky, bretty, citrusy fruity, floral, grassy, spicy, wood, light vinous. Sweet and acidic taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Oh man this is delicious. Sharp acid cut with some light lemon fruit. Perfect balance again of tart and funk. Good bubbles and lightly tart. Grape wine flavors are subtle but present and nicely complementary. Really tasty. Wish I could drink this stuff all the time.
CBC. Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity and barnyard. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate acidic. Dry and moderate acidic finish. 140516
CBC16, red session, tap. Clear pale yellow with a white head. aroma almost heavy sour and tart, woody, citrusy, floral notes). Flavor heavy sour (bret, wood, fruity), ending dry. Light body.

[5/14/16] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Red session. Yellow. Great funky aroma with fresh fruits, oak. Tart flavor, fresh, funky, fruity, oak. Quite light-bodied. Great and refreshing.
Sample at CBC 2016. Tart, funky and fruity smell. Very taste taste with wood. Refreshing.
On tap at CBC 2016 - day 2. Fruity and flowery aromas, lemons, cucumbers, white wine and very feint brett notes.
Tap @CBC16. Cloudy golden, small white head. Vinous aroma, green grapes. Acidic flavour, lemon and funk. Bone dry and fresh. Nice.

Red session, Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Clear pale golden beer with a decent white head. Tart woody aroma, caramel, perfume, citrus, some floral notes. Tart vinous flavor, woody, hay, grapes, some floral notes. 
Quite nice

Pours hazy yellow with low white head 
Aromas tart of over ripe red apples, garden leaves, hints of citrus, grapes , oak 
Taste has tart notes of over ripe fruits, green apples, green grapes, garden leaves
From tap at CBC 2016. It pours hazy golden with a creamy white head. The aroma is fruity and acidic. Quite fruity flavor with sour sweet berries. Light chlorine.
Pours clear golden with low white head. Aroma of grass, funk, citrus, lemongrass. Taste is medium grass tart with mild sweet finish. Light and crisp body with average carbonation.
Tap cbc. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma Brett, lactic, fruity, light wheat, light vinegar, fruity, white wine barrels. Taste is very sour, fruity, grapes, a light wheat.
Tap at CBC2016, Copenhagen. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, tartness, citrus, some Belgian yeast and malts.

Draught @ CBC 2016, Copenhagen. Pours yellowish with a smooth head. Aroma of oak, tart fruits, funky yeast and farmyard, vanilla and berries. Taste is smooth, tart and sourish with some oak, wood, vanilla and funky farmyard. Finish is tart, sourish and woody with some oak. Nice one.
Keg. Hazy yellow, medium sized white head. Pepper, lemon, hay, dry flowers, dry wood. Soft carbonation, low sweetness, medium sour. Crisp.

batch 1 bottle shared with a friend. poured a deep golden to light orange colour with a white head. first notice is that there is a lot of sweeter white wine in there. even mroe compared to the fermier version. lots of citrus, with dried apricots, peach, sweet pits, oak, minerals, tart, funky, dusty, crisp malts, lemon peel. wine barrels adds a bit of a sweetness to it. balanced. nice
Pour is yellow wirh a thin white head..Nose is musty, lemon, spice, oak, chard, spice...Taste is lemon, spice, peel, tart, oak, funk...
UPDATED: APR 21, 2016 Tart but not puckering. Citrus.  Stone fruit.  Peach sour patch kid.  Cloudy copper.  Wine.  Pretty tasty.  Oak.  On tap at cellar.

Cloudy yellow orange in color with foamy white head... Aroma of buttery Chardonnay oak, citrus, lemon, tart white grapes... Flavor is amazingly deep, lots of buttery chardonnay, oak, unripe peaches, peach pit, apricots... Creamy mouthfeel, lightly tart throughout... Amazing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - pours a fuzzy orange colour with white head. Medium sour fruity and floral hoppy aroma and taste, some nice citrus lemon zesty prominence, light malt, yeast, grapeskin, fruity dry finish.

Bottle @ Himmeriget. Pours hazy tiny orangish yellow with a frothy white head that leaves some sticky lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is tiny malty and funky with crackers, freshly baked white bread, oatmeal flakes, lemon juice, lime juice, hay, dry soil, minerals, leather, barnyard and lemon zest. Taste is sour, tiny malty and funky. Mouthfeel is soft, dry, tart and medium bodied. Finish is softly sour and thirst-quenching. Nothing too complex but a plain soft highly refreshing tart and funky saison. Enjoyable!
Bottle. Aroma is funky sour lemon candy with light brett. Tastes moderately sour and salty. Big lemon candy, light white wine, and light barnyard. Crushable. Perfect sweet/sour balance for my liking.

Blend #4, 10 oz wine glass draft at the Side Project Cellar in St. Louis, Missouri. The pour is a hazed yellow golden small a foamy white head. The aroma is a tart lemon along with a nice fresh natural grass wheat. The taste is the tart sour lemon up front, fast followed by bright fruit peach citrus, wheat character and finishes with a bit of the wood. The palate is light bodied with bright active carbonation and a tart clean finish. Super nice.
Bottle @ Himmeriget. ¨Light hazy dark golden pour with a fluffy off white head. Notes of funk, cheese, oaky, spritzy, citric, vanilla, light acidic and some light bitterness.

Bottle @ Himmeriget. pours hazy orange with a white head. The aroma is vinous with notes of white grapes, funky basement, floral notes, weak white pepper, tropical white wine and weak pear. Nice and complex. The taste is juicy and very vinous. pepper, citrus, gentle woody tannins, floral notes, pear and grapes. Nice one!

750. Thanks, S! Pours a hazy pale gold with a loose whitish head. Tangy, spicy nose, showing wildflowers, cloves, allspice, minerals. Creamy medium body with lively carb. Tangy, spicy mid palate--floral, savory, minerally. Mild tangy finish.

750 ml bottle shared with the group. The bottle was received from phaleslu. Thanks! The beer is a clear yellow with a big head of white foam. The aroma has funky apricots and blueberries. Soft acidity and some formal character. Really nice and refreshing. Medium body and soft carbonation.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a snifter. Hazy brigh golden with small white head. Aroma is tart, medium body, medium/well carbonation, and little carbonation. Taste is wonderful sour, some yeast, and some Wine wine.

Bottle @ Himmeriget, Copenhagen. 

Pours hazy orange with a medium white head.

Aromas of sweet esters, sweet citrus, citrus peel, green grapes, oaky, light lactic, funky cheesy notes. 

Taste is lactic sour, green grapes, citrus, esters, vanilla, vinous dry, lemon zesty. Nice!

Bottle @ himmeriget. 
Pour slightly murky dark yellow, with the smallest of White heads. 
Aroma is pretty darn complex, but norhing overpowering. 
White grapes, slight Wood, slight citrus peel, somewhat perfumed, slight green apples, slight cheese. 
Taste is slightly bitter up front, but deffinitly some sweet fruity juicieness. 
Medium bodied, semi flat carbonation. This is deli for sure. Namnam

Bottle from grownfool, Thanks! Hazy yellow, with a thin, frothy white head. Smells very winey, with a few tart notes as well. Some citrusy, oaky notes, as well. Taste is very sour / tart. Lemony, with a good deal of woody flavors. Some cherry as it warms. Very tasty.

A very nice saison. Nothing special but it's solidly done all the same. Happily drink the whole thing.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample during Jackie Os 10th Anniversary Extravaganza on 12/04/2015. Cloudy yellow-gold color with a medium white head that recedes steadily. Strings of lacing. Aroma of funky fruit, yeast and malt. Medium body with flavors of herbal yeast, vinous oak, malt and lemons. The finish is peppery yeast and tart fruit. Very good Saison overall.
Clear gold pour with a thick white head. Aroma of funk, malt and lemon. Malty and funky flavor with lemon peel accents before a sour citrus finish.
Smells like lemon and oak. Taste is lemon, crisp medium citric sourness, and a bit of oak. Light to medium body, light sharp carbonation, and no foam.
Bright yellow pour from draft at side project. White head. Super sour and dry. Super good.

Poured batch 3 from 750ml to glass. Hazy straw hue with fizzy white head that dissipated to a thin ring. Aroma is lemon, straw, lactic, peppercorn. Mouthfeel is refreshing with a light body and crisp carbonation. Taste is dry with a tart sourness following. Overall this is a nice sour saison.

750 mL bottle. Originally reviewed 2/24/2014.
Hazy yellow orange body. Nice white head. Good retention. Medium collar.

Wine barrel is prominent in the nose. Lemony. Oaky. Grainy wheat.

Taste is tart with lots of wine barrel. Sweet pale malt. Oaky. Lemony. Grainy wheat. Lingering oaky finish. Minimal funk to it.

Light body. Crisp and tart. Medium carbonation.
Very nice barrel aged saison. Flavorful.

Bottle; Pour is murky bright golden with a modest white head into this glass - it retains on the average side, with very light lacing presence. Love the color on this one. The nose is lemon zest, feint soap , moving to a perfume of florals, grasses, wet hay honestly - with a touch of earthen funk. Wow. It just gets better though - This brew starts off with minerals, heavy citrus, with wine barrel presence kicking things off incredibly smoothly - It moves to the tart / acid notes and it finishes off in such a memorable way. The path this experience takes is straight to near perfection in my book -

Sampled at The Festival in Florida. Aroma: wheat, wild hay. App: hazy straw, small head, no lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, so fluffy then comes this awesome dry acidify finish. Overall: almost shed a tear when I started drinking it. Its so well done. So fluff, so well balanced acidity. Wow!
Bottle. Yellow pour with a white head. Yeast and grain bouquet. Tart stone fruit, muted lemon, yeast, and grain highlights. Tasty with a good body and mouthfeel.

Draft: (Blend #3)
Cloudy yellow-gold with a small, off-white head.
Light fruit, sour/yeasty citrus aroma.
Taste is nice and funky.....orange-lemon, yeast, wood.....
Really very nice....tart and deep.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2016 Batch #2, 750mL bottle shared by Adam on 7/24/15Lightly hazy golden body is topped by a moderate amount of white head that slowly recedes to cover.Smacked in the nose with chardonnay....perhaps smacked isnt the right word, as I like chardonnay, and this is a fine example of it; not too buttery/oaky and with good acidity and juicy fruit notes.The flavor is a mouthful of chardonnay as well, albeit on a soft, tightly carbonated and lean body. Some lactic notes break through....almost no saison character....really grasping at straws to find much other than chardonnay here. Seems like the base beer must be nice, but theres just no getting past the wine character here.  4/4/4/2/9Batch #3 bottle, drunk Spring 2016.Lovely pour, as usual from SP, with a big, well-retained white head topping a minimally hazy, bright flaxen-golden body.Oak again, and wine, but its nowhere near the intense, overpowering levels of the previous batch.  While I think the complexity of this one is still a bit suspect, overall, being heavily given to oak/wine/tannin, this is certainly still respectable and a far cry from the pure Chardonnay bomb that was batch 2.  Score updated as an average of the 2 batches.  7/4/7/3/13

Acquired in a trade a few months ago. Shared 4 ways in stemware.

A - Nice looking pouroh, batch 2 of this. hazy dark golden orange. 2 finger solid white head

S - Dry aroma, coriander, spice, peppery, tannic and oaky. 

T - Very dry, a ton of wine notes.There is a faint sweetness at the finish. Lots of oak, tannic, grapes, honey. 

M - Excellent mouthfeel. has a sparkling wine with the thickness of beer mouthfeel to it

O - This beer is exceptional. I was afraid for more too-sour american wilds but this was very well crafted.

Shared by Dice, batch 2. Thick golden, no clarity. Small head but it sticks around. Aroma tart herbally Brett, nerds candy, and little sweet biscuit. Flavor is tartness cutting through the thick yet light maltiness. Very nice stuff.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: UPDATED: DEC 11, 2015 Batch 4. Beautiful. Tart and sharp. Nicely sour with a great carbonation. Most of this is the same, with more sour.  This is beautiful. Shared at a tasting hosted by Steebo on February 13. Batch 2. The pour on this one is a very cloudy yellow color with a nice white head and some excellent lacing as is slowly falls. The aroma is really bready. There is a lot of biscuit and Belgian yeast. There are some light fruits on the back end, and a bit of wine on the finish, but itâs pretty Belgian. The flavor is really Belgian-y. Lots of bready yeast and malts with some pepper spice and a light fruit on the back end. I appreciate that this beer is probably amazing, but Iâm just not into Saisons =[ The mouth feel is really bubbly, bright, and carbonated. The aftertaste is lingeringly malty and bready with a little lemongrass in there maybe. I want to like it, I really do

Saison du ble 

batch 2 - Many thanks to Kevin for the bottle.

Pours a cloudy peach-yellow color with a one finger broad, stable head.

The nose offers a complex tartness between citrus peel, sparkling wine, bretts and a note of vinegar. This impression gets enhanced, due to hay, wet grass, tree bark, earthy mushrooms and a mineral quality. Sweeter, fermented grapes blend flawlessly into the funky character of the beer, among a well pronounced foundation of straw and wheat.

Has a lower carbonation with an almost smooth mouthfeel, due to soft water and a medium body.

Begins with bread, minerals, unripe citrus pulp and hay. Old, fermented white grapes become recognizable during the middle part, revealing not only a fruity note, but also a mellow hop presence among sweeter turning malts, still providing a decent amount of earth. The beer got a sparkling wine aspect to it, leading to a very refreshing, slightly fruity impression, finishing with an enjoyable bitterness and a slick, long lasting citrus dryness.

Fantastic beer, with a generous depth of different flavors, while it comes together convincingly well. Exhibits a tart fruitiness, with both citrus and grapes, while hay and wheat build up an incredible soft, enjoyable mouthfeel, through which the flavors can unfold without any distractions. Finishes tart, while not getting monotonous sour, almost like a Belgian sour.

Pour out of bottle at FOBAB 2014, hazy almost milky yellow pour with white head, aroma brought notes of bread, biscuit, touch of yeast and doughy notes into some nice white fruit, peach, some slight white wine into a bit of grassy notes. Taste was a mix of nice bread, dough, yeast into some peppery notes, touch of white grape, peach, and a slight tropical fruit note into some grass, herbal notes, finishing slightly tart, slightly dry. Excellent.

(750ml bottle) cloudy medium yellow, fine white bubbles. Nose of clean lacto, honey, light brett, apricot, other stonefruit. Taste of apricot, peach, lacto, brett, light earth, yogurt, medium body, natural fine carbonation.

Sampled at THE FESTIVAL 2014 in LA with Linh and Scarlett. This was one of the first stands we visited, and enjoyed their beers why waiting in line for Cantillon & 3Font. Pours a deep hazy golden body with thick white lacing. Mouthfeel is minerals and medium-bodied with notes of lemon, light funk, wheat, sourdough, earthy funk, soft tart character, sour fruit and oak. Lightly dry towards the finish. Really nice.

Bottle... This beer rocks! Pours murky and light yellow with a small, creamy, white head. Decent retention. The aromatic standouts are damp wood, must and funky cheese. Medium-bodied with lazy carbonation. The flavor is lightly sour and lemony up front; tart and bready on the backside. A world class beer shared with the south Florida crew by landhoney!

750 ml bottle to snifter. Looks solid; a hazy golden orange with white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells bretty and yeasty with notes of oak and a bit of wheat. Tastes like it smells with a bit of well-balanced lacto as well. Some mild lemon. Pleasant on the palate with a nice amount of tartness for the body. Good beer.
Sampled during RBSG. From notes. Sour and fruity with loads of funk and some Brett.

One of Draft magazine top 25 of 2014, very tart and some wine characteristic. Wonderfull Brett coming through, so complex..need to have a few to catch all that is going on in this Chardonnay barrel creation. Awesome.

Bottle to glass. Pours a hazy golden yellow color with a small fizzy off white head. Aroma is a pleasant light oak, dry, light tartness, lemon citrus, barnyard funk. Flavor has a solid tartness to it, light lemon citrus, oak. Light in body with a lingering season citrus funk. Delicious!

Thanks to Mike for sharing this a few months back (from notes). Pours hazy gold with white head. Aroma: Pineapple, tropical juice nose. Taste: botanical, gin; again this "triscuit/snack cracker" thing I got in a previous Jester King beer in August ... maybe Im not crazy? Or I am, but consistent. Medium body, lively carbonation, slick texture. A little vomit, but in the best possible way. Overall: really nice. I tend to be overly skeptical of these new hyped places out of our market, but this is great. Reminds me of all I love in Upright.
On tap at brewery with pals. .nate and Suzie and sara and crew..tastes awesome...more sour then anything

Tap: Cloudy & hazed yellow body with a humungous, chunky eggshell head that takes about a year to settle. Creamy. Aroma packed with musty Bretty, old cobweb, & dusty cellar funk up front. Lightly tannic oak with a stone fruit & peach skin tartness that wafts its way in. Some pear, a touch of lactic notes, & a strong barn stall funk throughout. Taste has a bit more lemon, peach, & stone fruit out of the gate. Tart, bordering on sour. Introduced some mineral acidity & a touch more lactic acid, though not venturing too far into the yogurt realm. Wet hay & barnyard funk with a hint of that rotten pineapple & sharp lemon zest that you often get from certain strains of brettanomyces. Woody back-end, not quite vinous but dry, woody, & with a nice fruity acidity to finish things up. Simply a great saison with a nice barrel aged character that adds tartness, complexity, & acidity. Bravo.

On tap at The Side Project Cellar - Pours hazy yellow with a white head. The aroma has rich malt for the style, mild tartness, soft herbs, bugs in the back and some nectar fruit. It has a medium soft body with light soft carbonation. The flavor starts off with light citrus, lactic acid, lightly toasted malt, pepper, other spices and sharp fruit. The finish shows a bit of barrel, white wine and is quite refreshing. Another beer from side project that is on the subtle side. Nice.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2015 Draft sample at Fobab 14. Aroma is floral farmhouse and weisse. taste is farmhouse Brett with a slight tart finish. Kinda reminds me of HF saisons. Decent but nothing crazy. 3.6

Bottle Batch 3, day after release. Aroma is sugar and sour lemonheads. Doesnt have the sour or acidic punch that Im used to from side project.  A bit more restrained, but making this beer more of a session than a slow sipping puckering sour. Upping this a couple points, was probably a little underwhelming at fobab, especially after drinking so many high power sours.

On tap: The aroma consists moderate florals, sour/funky lemon, oak, and a touch of apple. The flavor starts with sour/tart citrus and lemon. The finish has light oak, and the faintest hint of band aid. Its light-medium bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel.
750, thanks Matt. I liked this one a lot. Very crispy and biscuity. Lots of nuances and grainy type tartness. Brett is dominant. Soft carb and mouthfeel. I didnt want to like it but i did.
Bottle thanks to Kris. Pours a cloudy orange with small white head. The aroma is funk and brett. Very good.

Very nice saison pours a straw peach color with fluffy white head. Aroma is very very fruit forward without actually having any fruit. Earthy, Pear, Apricot, quite doughy, and some melon. Taste is tart pear and apricot with quite a lot of doughy sweetness and some funk. Overall this is quite nice and I really enjoyed it but not up there with HF and Forest and Main.

From bottle at What the Funk?!? - GABF 2014. Pour is hazy lemon with a frothy white head and sticky lacing. Funky, juicy, lemony, biscuit, pineapple, white grapes, light pepper and doughy aroma. Taste is big stone fruit, biscuit, some straw, white pepper, honey, oaky, and floral with a dry finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Solid BA saison.

750mL bottle, pours a cloudy pale golden with a small white head. Aroma brings out rustic farmhouse notes, some floral notes and feint licorice. Flavour is bretty and juicy, with rustic notes, light fruitiness, and funk. Moderate complexity, with perhaps too much fruitiness. Still, very nice stuff.
Cloudy yellow with a pale head. Aroma is green olives, sourdough, wheat, saison spice. Medium bodied, sweet and citrusy on the palate. Taste is orange juice, sourdough, saison spice.

On tap at the Brasserie V Great Taste Eve Party - Pours hazy golden with a thin ring of white head. Nose is dusty yeast, light grape, dry pale malt, a little tartness, and some astringency. Taste is gentle white grape, dusty yeast, pale malt, and a lightly sweet finish. Gentle carbonation, and a real soft body.

Tasted on 2/8/14 from a 750mL bottle at the RBWG Grand Tasting, big thanks to phaleslu for sharing!!! Pours cloudy pale yellow with a thick white head that slowly recedes to average lace. The nose is tart lemon with a lactic touch, and plenty of spicy saison yeast. The flavor is nicely lactic lemon tart with the same spicy yeast, and a lightly nutty touch. The body is medium with lively carbonation and a long lactic tart lemon finish.

750 mL bottle shared by noodleuser at the DC Summer Saison & Sour Tasting, 7/12/14. Pours a hazy yellow color with a thin foamy white head. Good head retention. Aroma of pale malt, white grape, mild tart fruity finish. The taste is jammy tropical fruits, white grape, wine, yeast. Medium bodied, lingering spice.
Bottle courtesy of noodleuser, thank you! Cloudy golden yellow color. beautiful farmhouse aroma. Very tasty barnyard funk. Good stuff.
Special tapping at BrasserieV, complements of TheAlum - thanks! Hazy yellow pour with a slight white head. Tart, funky, wood notes in the finish. Really nice!

Sample @ RBWG Asheville After Party. Amber pour with a small head. Distinct orange cheese rind. Some dry Belgian countryside yeastiness. Soft brett tartness. Mellow spring fruits. Pear and a touch of citrus. Some parmesan. Nimble, evolving flavors. Cool stuff.

Bottle cracked by Alan at Ryans tasting. Poured golden with beautiful head and light lace. Notes are mostly minerals and sour wood with some dry fruits, and a touch of chardonnay in the finish but wasnt overwhelming butter chardonnay which can happen to a lot of these saisons. Complex and dry in the finish.

Bottle shared by noodleuser. Pours lightly hazy gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with light lacing. Aroma lemon, earthy hops and yeast with cracker malt and pear esters. Flavor is moderate fruits, vinous notes, light honey malt, pear and apple esters with spices and a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation.

Very nice saison on the sour funky side of things. Pours cloudy blonde and has some tropical citrus fruit aroma I cant place. Comes together very well though. Medium sour finish with tartness thanks to noodleuser.

Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty spicy sour yeasty aroma. Fruity malty spicy tart flavor with weak yeasty hints. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty tart finish.

Bottle during RBSG 2014 Bus Tour at Perennials Barrel Room. Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of funk, floral notes, spices, herbs. Tastes of funk, floral notes, citrus, herbs, spices. Medium body with a dry finish. Nice.

From a bottle at the Brewery
Pours a hazy yellow with a smallish, but well retained head. 

Its got a nice floral and limestone thing happening in the aroma with some barn-yard-y funk and a big of light fruit.

The flavor is dry & a touch boozy (surprisingly), Its got a great strong minerally presence to it with some nice tartness and light bitterness. 

Nicely balanced and really original.
750ml bottle. Golden appearance, very light and fluffy body, ample tartness, light frutis, very complex and tasty.

Bottle @ Perennial. Cloudy straw pour with a white head. Slight cobweb and blue cheese funk on the nose. A nice lemon zest note, some oak, straw, and golden apple. Mild sweetness of apple and melon on the palate. Zesty lemon sourness on the back end. Fairly mild funk. Same sort of cobweb/basement note as the nose.

Sampled along the RBSG Bus Tour 2014. Bottle at the brewery. Moderately tart with floral and citrus notes. Amazingly dry and quenching with some barnyard and funk. Well balanced between all of these aspects.
Bottle - Lots of funk off the bat with some light citrus and barrel notes. Cloudy yellow with a frothy white head. Brett funk with some hay and light tart citrus.

This beer is very pale and cloudy w/ a small head of mixed size bubbles. This has great fruity and floral fermentation character w/ a ton of complexity and nothing really sticking out. It is lightly tart and while my sample was small it seemed to be both light and drinkable enough to enjoy in some quantity. This is an excellent beer to be sure.

Aroma: Brett, Chardonnay, Mild Pear

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw/Orangish Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Decent Lacing

Taste: Brett, Yeast, Chardonnay, Mild Apple

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Tart, Mildly Funky
Sample at Culmination Fest: Poured a hazy yellow in color with a white head. Aroma was very funky citrus fruit. Taste was very funky barn yard with sour grain, citrus acidic, and oaky.

Bottle shared by Hoppypocket, thanks bro! Pours a heavily hazed golden with a low white head that leaves some lacing. Nose is of sour fruits, hay, a little funk and unfortunately some awkward sulfur (nothing offputting but it would have been near perfect without this). Taste is nice and tart, funky with some wheat flavors along some lemon and other sour fruits. Carbonation was moderate and mouthfeel juicy (nice!). Really nice and really refreshing, a nice way to start our discovery of Side Project!

bottle shared by hoppypocket, many thanks bro! pours cloudy almost dirty pale yellow with a small off-white head, some retention and lacing. wheaty, small yellow fruits, dusty bretts, bitter lemon, candy-like citric powder, herbs, spiciness, gently woodsy and tart. lively carbonation, light body, pleasantly and tartly lemony, herbal and delicately astringent finish. spectacular.

75cl, Batch 1, new exclusive American brew Anno 2013, with Brettanomyces, thx alot to Koen for sharing!, very complex brew, fruity/woody and slightly floral/vinous, easy to drink, very balanced, cloudy, good head, very good brew

Cloudy golden pour yields soapy, messy lace. Beautiful. 

Bright, funky, citric aroma piques my interest. All sorts of awesome complexity as I sip: epic depth, perfectly balanced sourness, funk for days. Jesus that's good. Goddamn Cory, stop killing it.

Batch 1 - 750 ml bottle - kindly shared by Fux. Pours hazy light yellow with a steady dense white head. Intense peach aroma, riesling wine, minerality, vanilla nibs and white peach. Light to medium body, bits of spiciness and peach and hay in the taste. This is one of the best non-Belgian saisons I have tasted.

Bottle at tasting. Hazy pale gold pour, creamy white head. Aroma is really grainy, really bretty as well, winey oak notes, white wine and brett, certainly something Ive smelled before, reminds me of SARA beers, lots of peachy fruity notes. Tastes a lot like white wine, very fruity, lots of peach. Palate is light-medium bodied, really soft carbonation, med-dry. Nice.

Bottle (750 ml). Shared by Fux, thanks! Hazy yellow/golden with a medium white head and good lacing. Aroma is lemony and yeasty with white wine and citrus notes. Taste is also lemony and citric with Chardonnay, nice fruitiness, light sweetness and light to moderate tartness. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Winey mouthfeel. Slightly dry finish. Refreshing, tasty and complex barrel-aged Saison. The barrel treatment doesnt hide the Saison components. Good balance.

Bottle shared at the 2014 tasting in the Cellar of Moeder Lambic Saint-Gilles. Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma of Bretty funk, peppery saison yeast and light fruit. Flavor is light sweet and bitter and a little sour. Big peach coming out in the aroma with light vinous aspects. Over medium bodied with soft carbonation.

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma of light sour and Brett notes, light wine and oak, pale malts and wheat, and some light fruits. Flavor the same with a cool blend of everything, especially the sourness, the oak, and wine. Average texture. A very nice beer.
Pours a cloudy peachy color with a small head. Very delicate flavor and aroma. Peach throughout. Faint wheat and acidity. Very nice, but not great.

Bottle courtesy of a recent Tampa Tasting. Pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Nose is oak, sweet malt, tart citrus, yeast, and some oaky chardonnay. Flavor is similar with wheat, citrus, tartness, yeast, some funk, and hits of malt throughout. Complex, enjoyable saison.
Hazy yellow with a really nice white head. Great beer! Funky, sour, stone fruit, white wine grapes, perfect mouthfeel. Damn SP rocks.
Bottle. Hazy golden pour with white head. Citra, funky yeast, tropical aromas. Crisp citrus, no real funky tones, light wine and oak tones with a nice clean finish.

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2015 All these Side Project beers are kinda similar, but quite good. This one has a very yogurty nose character and is a bit fluffy, if that makes any sense. A little less drinkable than some of the others because the tartness is more pronounced.

Also, too much wine barrel in the finish.

Pour is a hazed bright golden yellow with a tight white head and thick lacing. Nose is heavy yeast and creamy lacto up front with a strong balance of dry white wine and wet oak. Their yeast is very unique and different, Im not really a huge fan. It gets tangy and spicy but has a strange cream of wheat thing going on. Taste has less of the cream of wheat, yeast is uniquely tangy, lemon zest and a hint of spice. Stronger oak, less wet wood, very dry in the finish and the chard barrels give it a temptation quality, just not nearly as well done. The lacto probably adds to the yeast flavor, similar to the saisonneer without as much off flavor. Its ok.

750 ml. bottle at a sharing. Pours a cloudy pale gold with a decent white head. Aroma of funk, citrus, and straw. Taste is lemon, straw, funk, fruit, and grain. Finish is tart, funky, and dry. Very nice.

750 ml bottle shared by phaleslu at RBWG grand tasting. Pours a hazy golden color with a medium sized white head. The aroma and flavor have a tart citrus, sour green apple, wheat malt base, tangy, mild Brett funk, lactic acidity, some Chardonnay barrel influences, some dryness to the finish. Solid.
Pours a cloudy yellow. Aroma is funky, oak and Brett taste is tart, dry, funky Brett and oak. Big vinous notes.

[ Bottle ][ RBWG Asheville Grand Tasting ][ 750mL ][ Globe ][ Free ][ 2/8/14 ]
>> Thanks phaleslu for the share. Full haze straw pour. Nose is juicy fresh pear, pie crust, sweet cream butter. Taste is tart apple, Granny Smith, pear, peach, pineapple. Juicy, tart, quenching. Beautiful, fluffy saison. Better than the Fermier I thought. Impressive.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2016 Bottle at the RBWG grand tasting thanks to Peter! Pours a hazy light yellow with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a nice floral light fruit, slightly juice, with a slight funk and grass note. Flavor has more of a tart fruit note with light funk and earthy grain.
Bottle at RBWG. Pours cloudy yellow gold with white head. Nose and taste of lemon, saison yeast, bready alcohol (light), brett and light lacto sourness. Medium body.
RBWG Winter Gathering, Asheville, courtesy of phaleslu. Pours a hazy yellow color with white head. Citrus, funky, lemon, Nice flavor.
Pale yellow/orange pour with white head and lace. Aroma is wheaty malt and sour. Very tart with the wheat and the brett making for a dry finish. Medium/lite body with good carbonation. good beer

750ml bottle, thanks to Fail Slew. End part of the bottle. Very nice floral yeasty citrusy aroma. Hazy yellow orange color. Thin off-white head, good bits of lace. Moderate tart taste, light sweet. Very smooth, lighter carbonation. Medium-plus body. Good, kind of chewy thicker texture. Maybe its dat yeast. Fantastic saison.

Bottle at RBWG Asheville Grand Tasting. Pours hazy yellow with a wispy white foam head. Nice tangy aroma, lightly lactic, some lemons and pale malts. Light sweet flavor, airy, some lovely tart lemons, straw. Light bodied with fine to average carbonation. Lovely tart finish, lots of citric lemons, light doughy bread. Superlative stuff. Excellent.
Bottle pour hazy light yellow. Nose tart and citrus,slight wheat. Taste very clean, tart sour up front, Mid palate some continued tart. Mild sour finish.
Bottle @ RBWG. Pours a cloudy yellow appearance with a white head. Lemon, yogurt, honey, lactic aroma. Juicy pineapple, lemon, dry white wine flavor. Drinks grate.

Batch 1, 750 ml bottle into a HF wine glass. Pours a hazy orange/amber body with an amazing white fluffy head that doesnt fade away at all. Excellent lacing and retention. Aroma is a huge wave of white wine barrels and brett funk. Musky and earthy balanced by the intense sweetness of the wine. Lemons, wheat, grass and ripe apples. Taste is initially sharp and lactic but immediately met by a smoothness. Oak, crazy white wine notes, lemons and fruit, wheat, light spice and some funk. Not very light at all, in fact its quite heavy in flavor almost coming across as wine. Very complex and intense while remaining highly drinkable and refreshing. Lingering grape notes that just stick around. Mouth feel is full and coating yet effervescent and tart. This is a standout saison and right up there with the wine barrel aged HF offerings.

750 ml bottle from Keir- thanks again, Keir! Pours a semi-cloudy gold color with not much head. Looks flatter than the Saison du Fermier next to it. Aroma of funky brett, straw, chardonnay, earth, herbs, lemon, and yogurt- some lactic quality to this. Flavor of lemon, light florals, apple, chardonnay, straw, bready malts, herbs, wheat, and funky brett. Light-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a tart, oaky, funky mouthfeel. Not as much carbonation as the Fermier, and that probably plays a role in this one being slightly more subdued. But this is another fantastic saison from Side Project.

750ml bottle (b1) pours hazy golden yellow with big head. Nose is earthy citrus, hayfield, fruity. Taste is nice balanced tart citrus with some light funk, white grape. Finish is dry tart citrus, apple, lots of nice white wine notes and earthy oak barrel tones. Fantastic!

Bottle shared thanks to JBPortland ! Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow color with a finger of tight white foam. The nose is barnyard brett, wheat grain and a touch of swampy stonefruit. The palate is bright and lively with lots of underlying complexity. Big grainy wheat backbone mingles with toasted vanilla, tight lime acidity, lemon peel, vinous fruit... very refreshing with some nice lacto yogurt tang drawing out the finish.

Bottle. Pour is cloudy yellow with a medium, active white head. Aroma is lemony and tart with hints of funk, light spice, and faint wood. Flavor is also tart and lemony with funky notes coming through after that. Distinct, but faint, blue cheese notes in the finish. Also lightly spicy. Very Very drinkable but nice complexity. Really well done.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2013 Bottle. Batch 1. Chitl. Aroma of creamy lemony yogurt. Soft earthy pear skins. Moderate yogurt sourness backed by a creamy rustic hay wheat. Some dusty fog as well. Balanced quite nicely. Effervescent. Complex. Tasty. Some reps. Lifting as well.

Sampled at an ESBLS tasting, thanks thinkin drinkin. It poured a hazy golden color with a small white head. The aroma had that puckery nose to it, with a tart and farmhouse lemony essence. It had a light pale grainy backbone. The taste had a little white wine and lemon with pale grains throughout. The body was creamy with a light carbonation. Thanks for sharing.

Bottle at Tony/Jim BA Birthday Extravaganza 2013 (Western Springs, IL). Pours a nice golden straw hue, a nice haziness in the body tapers out to some brighter glow on the edges and bottom. Creamy whitish head atop stays as a nice layer, thicker ring laces throughout. Aromas show a bright tart lactic edge, gentle funky brett comes in behind with straw, bready grains and cereal elements. A touch of dough, lactic yogurty feel. Some gentle spiciness is softened, lemon zest, fruit. Nice stuff, fresh and vibrant. Initial is lighter end of the fold in body showing some good sourness, lemony lactic zing meets some softer yogurt, gentle cereal grains, bread, and dry crackling straw. Touches of flaked wheat, crab apple and pear. Some nice lemon rind perkiness as we hit the middle, more yogurt, funky cobwebs start to cut through a bit more. Some dryness, deadened body into the backend. Tart, funky and dry, some cobwebs really start to stick. Its lighter bodied but offers a pleasant feel on the palate, enveloping it with plenty of sour lactic zing, gentle bready malt backgroun and that developing bretty funk. Dry, a bit slick as we finish up. This is really nice stuff, sour and lively, nice development and flow. Wow.

Sampled at esbls. Hazy golden. A sour funky aroma with fruit under. Light funk in the flavor far from over piwers. Nice gentle fruit with pale malts. Very light white wine. A pleasant beer. I like it.
Strong Brett on the nose. Pours a perfect color and saison haze. Taste is incredible Brett and lacto character. Great mouthfeel, and finishes sour. Outstanding saison!

Bottle thanks to Corey. Thx dude... Pours golden hazy and consistent throughout and topped with a creamy white head... Perky tart and creamy lactic farmhouse lemony essence. Light pale grainy backend. Nice... White wine essence and lemon with pale grain throughout. Clean with a nice lactic tartness. Creamy bodied, easy going with a lighter level of carbonation. Very nice.
